page.title: 17EAST MEON - VILLAGE
page.content: The village of East Meon is situated at the point where the River Meon, flowing northwards from its source in the springs of South Farm,is forced to flow westwards by the presence of the steep slopes of Park Hill (207 ms) to the north,which blocks its course.The village has developed here in the small area of lowland,in the river valley between Park Hill and the Lower Hill (136ms) to the south.The village probably grew up here because of the presence of a water supply in an otherwise dry chalk landscape and its growth was probably due to the fact thatit became a minor route centre for the area.The village,which was in existence by the time of the Domesday Book,has grown along these 2 roads but has always remained quite small.Today some of its population still work in agriculture but many have retired here
